釋.definition: to explain; to release; Buddha (abbr. for 釋迦牟尼|释迦牟尼[Shi4 jia1 mou2 ni2]); Buddhism

釋出.definition: to release; to make available; to liberate; disengagement

釋名.definition: "Shiming", late Han dictionary, containing 1502 entries, using puns on the pronunciation of headwords to explain their meaning

釋嫌.definition: to forget bad feelings; to mend a relationship

釋尊.definition: another name for Sakyamuni 釋迦牟尼佛|释迦牟尼佛, the historical Buddha

釋念.definition: (literary) to be reassured; not to worry

釋懷.definition: to get over (a traumatic experience, misgivings etc)

釋手.definition: to let go; to loosen one's grip; to put sth down

釋放.definition: to release; to set free; to liberate (a prisoner); to discharge

釋文.definition: interpreting words; to explain the meaning of words in classic texts; to decipher an old script

釋疑.definition: to dispel doubts; to clear up difficulties

釋義.definition: the meaning of sth; an explanation of the meaning of words or phrases; definition; an interpretation (of doctrine); religious doctrine

釋讀.definition: to read and interpret ancient texts; to decipher

釋迦佛.definition: Sakyamuni Buddha (Sanskrit: sage of the Sakya); Siddhartha Gautama (563-485 BC), the historical Buddha and founder of Buddhism

釋迦牟尼.definition: Shakyamuni (Sanskrit for "the Sage of the Shakyas", i.e. the Buddha, Siddhartha Gautama)

釋迦牟尼佛.definition: Sakyamuni Buddha (Sanskrit: sage of the Sakya); Siddhartha Gautama (563-485 BC), the historical Buddha and founder of Buddhism
